intro: Diphysa villosa, commonly known as the hairy diphysa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Diphysa villosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
